question_text: Which among the following is the best in diagnosing hepatic hemochromatosis?

options.C: Gastrohepatic lymph nodes should not exceed 8 mm
options.D: Pelvic lymph nodes should not exceed the diameter of 6 mm

question_text: Among the following, what is the imaging procedure of choice in evaluating the bile ducts for stones?

options.A: The central zone makes up most of the prostate gland
options.B: The peripheral zone is high in signal intensity in T1
options.C: The signal intensity in T1-weighted imaging is directly related to the proportion of glandular elements
options.D: Zonal anatomy of the prostate gland is best depicted in T2-weighted images.

options.C: It is useful in differentiating dependent atelectases from interstitial lung disease involving the subpleural and dependent portions of the lung
options.D: Subpleural nodules are more visible in the prone position

question_text: Why is CT scan not recommended in the work-up for thyroid malignancies?

options.A: Contrast-enhanced CT scanning can delay iodine-131 therapy for up to 6 months
options.B: Dental amalgam artifacts may preclude identification of submandibular nodal metastasis
options.C: High radiation dose exposure from CT scan may change the biologic behavior of thyroid cancer
options.D: Higher sensitivity of MRI in detection of adjacent soft tissue invasion and regional lymphadenopathy

question_text: What is the most significant obstacle to successful MR imaging of the lungs?

options.B: Poor signal potential of the aerated lung parenchyma
